decks.notes: This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control the board with disruptive spells. By using mana ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talismans, the deck aims to cast large threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker ahead of the curve. The Eldrazi creatures in the deck also provide additional value with their abilities, while spells like Kozilek's Command and Ancient Stirrings help maintain control and card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with eldritch horrors and outvalue them in the late game.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to constantly recur cards from the graveyard, specifically artifacts like Mox Amber and Mishra's Bauble, to generate mana and fuel powerful combos with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. Urza's Saga helps find key pieces, while Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble provide additional win conditions. The deck also features disruption in the form of cards like Sink into Stupor and Unholy Heat, while Thassa's Oracle serves as a backup win condition. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with its synergies.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to create a combo loop that allows the player to continuously cycle through their deck, generating mana and tokens through various artifacts and spells. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student are key pieces to recurring important cards from the graveyard. The goal is to eventually generate enough resources to cast a lethal Grapeshot or overwhelming Malevolent Rumble to defeat the opponent in one big turn. The deck thrives on synergy between artifacts, spells, and graveyard recursion to overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Birthing Ritual and White Orchid Phantom to play powerful creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Solitude. By using Ephemerate and Flickerwisp, the deck can repeatedly exile and return creatures for extra value. Ranger-Captain of Eos and Eternal Witness provide additional utility and card advantage. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early with aggressive creatures while maintaining control with removal spells and disruption. Mana fixing from cards like Flagstones of Trokair and Lands like Temple Garden helps ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive Boros creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent, while also incorporating powerful effects such as Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. It includes a mix of creature removal with cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, as well as disruption with Static Prison and Blood Moon. The deck also benefits from mana-fixing lands like Arid Mesa and Marsh Flats. Thraben Charm and Guide of Souls provide additional versatility and resilience, making it a versatile and potent Aggro deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and graveyard manipulation. It utilizes cards like Thought Scour to fill the graveyard for cards like Unearth and Graveyard Trespasser, while also deploying powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters to close out the game. The mana base is tailored to efficiently cast spells with a mix of fetchlands and dual lands. The deck aims to control the game through a combination of disruption and proactive threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and bounce effects. It also utilizes cards that mill the opponent's deck, such as Thought Scour and Psychic Frog, to control their resources. The deck aims to control the board using cards like Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters, while also deploying threats like Murktide Regent to close out the game. The mana base includes fetch lands to help fix colors and enable delve cards like Cling to Dust, with a mix of islands and swamps for consistency.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and creature buffs to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board while boosting the power of creatures like Guide of Souls and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional creature support, while Goblin Bombardment offers direct damage. The mana base is built around fetching lands with cards like Arid Mesa and Marsh Flats to ensure consistent casting of spells. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

This deck focuses on using the Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate a large amount of mana to quickly ramp into powerful threats like Primeval Titan. By utilizing lands that provide multiple mana, such as Gruul Turf and Urza's Saga, and key cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, the deck aims to assemble the necessary pieces to put Primeval Titan into play and search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes utility lands like Cavern of Souls and Bojuka Bog to interact with the opponent or protect its own threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Underworld Breach to create powerful combos that allow for repeated use of artifacts like Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble for infinite loops. The goal is to set up a board state where you can mill yourself or your opponent, eventually winning the game with Thassa's Oracle or Malevolent Rumble. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Orim's Chant to protect your combo and disrupt your opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of cards that do not require lands to function effectively, allowing for quick and consistent plays. By focusing on a landless strategy, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up powerful combos using cards like Beyeen Veil, Goblin Charbelcher, and Lotus Bloom. By utilizing a variety of disruption and control cards, as well as powerful combo pieces, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a win.

The deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing creatures with strong abilities and a mix of burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards that provide additional support and control elements to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to outpace the opponent with early aggression and efficient removal, leading to a swift victory. The key strategy is to establish a board presence quickly and apply pressure consistently throughout the game, forcing the opponent to react defensively or risk being overrun.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan and gain an advantage. The deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the board to secure a victory before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Guide of Souls and Goblin Bombardment for added versatility and reach.

The primary focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus. The deck aims to control the game's pace and outcome by countering key spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage through effects like Thought Scour and Cling to Dust. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Orcish Bowmasters and Shoot the Sheriff to further disrupt the opponent's board state and maintain control throughout the game.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. By efficiently removing threats from the opponent's board, countering key spells, and constantly drawing cards, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. With a mix of tempo plays and powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Graveyard Trespasser, the deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building towards a winning position. The deck's win condition is to establish a dominant board presence and close out the game with powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through various removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful threats such as Emrakul, the Promised End and Sheoldred's Edict. By utilizing cards like Profane Tutor and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck can search for key pieces and synergies to outvalue and outlast opponents. The inclusion of cards like Cling to Dust and Necrodominance allows for graveyard interaction, while cards like Cabal Coffers and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth provide mana ramp and fixing. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and establish dominance through efficient control strategies.
